cjtb

  • things I'm doing (at August 2024)
    • investing in frontier tech at Blackbird
      • I source new investments, run point on new and follow-on investments, do some light work with LPs (e.g. for coinvestment opportunities), and do portfolio support things (e.g. board shadowing work and fundraising support).
      • companies I have been involved with include PsiQuantum, Redactive, Syenta, Remedy Robotics, Vow, Spaceduck, Aquila, Open Star, Nomad Atomics, Gilmour Space, Multitudes, Baraja, Inventia, SunDrive, and Cortical Labs.
      • I've helped deploy >A$100M in rounds from preseed to beyond Series D.
    • building Foundry, the founder dev/preaccelerator program for PhD students I started at Blackbird
      • Foundry exists to empower Australian and Kiwi PhD students and EMCRs to start or join interesting companies. We don't believe in "research commercialisation". We believe in research talent.
      • We've run one Foundry cohort each year since 2022. We have an NPS > 70. The companies that have come out of Foundry have raised from top-tier VCs, been headhunted by YC, and Blackbird has invested in more of them than they have YC or Startmate companies in the time Foundry has existed (absolutely, but much more if you take this proportionally).
      • Foundry alumni that are active include Aquila, Andromeda, Synbiote, Unsloth, Kite Magnetics, GreenDynamics, Cell Bauhaus, Preview Health, Graft AI, Iceberg, and Twisted.
      • We wrote a Manifesto that did its job (ruffled some feathers, brought out some supporters, changed some minds).
    • helping the Australian Government build its quantum industry as a member of the National Quantum Advisory Committee
      • we released Australia's first National Quantum Strategy in 2023, which laid the groundwork for >$1B in investment into quantum things by the Commonwealth and State Governments.
  • things I have previously done
    • added some momentum at nonprofit DeadlyScience as first employee
    • did my undergrad in chemistry and mathematics, with hons in quantum simulation under Ivan Kassal
      • Ivan is a great researcher and supervisor with a wonderful group
      • a paper related to my hons work
